body_html:
@vlasenkov your debugging is exactly correct. However, your PR seems wrong.

Let me be a bit more clear.

In your patch, this line: #if BLAS_IS_ACCELERATE. Right now you will not go into this region, because we do not set BLAS_IS_ACCELERATE as a C define anywhere. We only set it as a CMake variable.

So even with your patch, we will always go into the #else region in line 30.
You can easily test this by putting some syntax errors inside the region of #if BLAS_IS_ACCELERATE and it should not trigger.

Let me be a bit more clear.
In your patch, this line: #if BLAS_IS_ACCELERATE. Right now you will not go into this region, because we do not set BLAS_IS_ACCELERATE as a C define anywhere. We only set it as a CMake variable.
So even with your patch, we will always go into the #else region in line 30.
You can easily test this by putting some syntax errors inside the region of #if BLAS_IS_ACCELERATE and it should not trigger.
body:
@vlasenkov your debugging is exactly correct. However, your PR seems wrong.

Let me be a bit more clear.

In your patch, this line: `#if BLAS_IS_ACCELERATE`. Right now you will not go into this region, because we do not set `BLAS_IS_ACCELERATE` as a C define anywhere. We only set it as a CMake variable.

So even with your patch, we will always go into the `#else` region in line 30.
You can easily test this by putting some syntax errors inside the region of `#if BLAS_IS_ACCELERATE` and it should not trigger.
